Submodules¶

a10.asvr.attestation module¶

a10.asvr.attestation.attest(e, p, aps)¶

This is the attestation process. Adds the claim if not an error to the database - well depends upon the kind of error, eg: network timeout, 404 etc

Params uuid4 e:The item id of the elent
Params uui4 p:The itemi do the policy
Params dict aps:
 the additional paraeters to be used
Returns ResultCode:
 
Return type:ResultCode
a10.asvr.attestation.resolvePolicyIntent(element, policy, additionalparameters)¶

The type are STR, STR and DICT (!!! <- dict is really important!!!)

This function actually resolves the policy intent It returns a claim structure

a10.asvr.attestation.verify(cid, rule)¶

a10.asvr.claims module¶

a10.asvr.claims.addClaim(e)¶

Adds a claim to the database. The following fields MUST be present: payload, header.as_requested, header.as_received, header.element, header.policy

In the future we will add header.ta_received, header.ta_complete

Params dict e:a dictionary with claim informatino
Returns:the itemid of the claim on success
Return type:ReturnCode
a10.asvr.claims.getAssociatedResults(i)¶

Gets a list of results associated with the given claim id from the database

Params int n:limit to n results
Returns:list of result structures as a dict
Return type:list dict
a10.asvr.claims.getClaim(i)¶

Gets a claim from the database with the given itemid

Params str i:an itemID of a claim
Returns:the claim as a dictionary
Return type:ReturnCode
a10.asvr.claims.getClaims(n)¶

Gets a list of claim itemids from the database

Returns:the claim itemids as a list
Return type:list str
a10.asvr.claims.getClaimsFull(n=50)¶

Gets a list of claims from the database

Params int n:limit to n results
Returns:list of claim structures as a dict
Return type:list dict

a10.asvr.elements module¶

a10.asvr.elements.addElement(e)¶

Adds an element of basetype Element to the attestation database.

Unless there is some database failure this function will always add a new element with a new itemid if the syntax check is successful.

The syntax check involves ensuring that the necessary base fields have been set.

Parameters:e (dict) – The element parameter
Returns:return code structure
Return type:ResultCode with either the itemID as a string in case of success or a string with an error message otherwise
a10.asvr.elements.deleteElement(i)¶

Deletes a single element from the database by its itemID.

Parameters:i (str) – the element ID, usually a UUID as a string or whatever is defined in a10.structures.identity
Returns:return code structure
Return type:ResultCode
a10.asvr.elements.getElement(i)¶

Gets a single element from the database by its itemID.

Parameters:i (str) – the element ID, usually a UUID as a string or whatever is defined in a10.structures.identity
Returns:return code structure
Return type:ResultCode
a10.asvr.elements.getElementByName(n)¶

Gets a single element from the database by its name.

Parameters:n (str) – the element’s name
Returns:return code structure
Return type:ResultCode
a10.asvr.elements.getElements()¶

Returns a list of elementIDs

Returns:a list of elementIDs
Return type:str list
a10.asvr.elements.getElementsFull()¶

Returns a list of everything in the database.

Returns:a list of elementIDs
Return type:str list
a10.asvr.elements.updateElement(e)¶

Modifies a given element. The element must contain a valid itemid

Parameters:e (Element) – The element parameter
Returns:return code structure
Return type:ResultCode with either the itemID as a string in case of success or a string with an error message otherwise

a10.asvr.expectedvalues module¶

a10.asvr.expectedvalues.addExpectedValue(e)¶

Adds an expected value structure

Parameters:e (ExpectedValue) – the expected value as a dict. Must not contain an itemid - as this will be overwritten with a generated ID.
Returns:returns Success and the generated itemid, or ADDITEMFAIL and a message
Return type:ReturnCode
a10.asvr.expectedvalues.deleteExpectedValue(i)¶

Adds an expected value structure

Parameters:i (itemid) – an itemid of an expected value
Returns:returns Success and the generated itemid, or DELETEITEMFAIL and a message
Return type:ReturnCode
a10.asvr.expectedvalues.getExpectedValue(i)¶

Returns an expected value structure

Parameters:i (itemid) – the itemID of the expected value
Returns:returns Success and a dictionary of the expected value, or ADDITEMFAIL and a message
Return type:ReturnCode
a10.asvr.expectedvalues.getExpectedValueForElementAndPolicy(e, p)¶

Returns an expected value structure

Parameters:
  • e (itemid) – the itemID of the element
  • p (itemid) – the itemID of the policy
Returns:

returns Success and a dictionary of the expected value, or ADDITEMFAIL and a message
Return type:

ReturnCode
a10.asvr.expectedvalues.getExpectedValuesForElement(e)¶

Returns all the expected values in the database which refer to a given element itemID

Parameters:i (itemid) – the itemID of the element
Returns:the expectedvalue
Return type:ReturnCode
a10.asvr.expectedvalues.getExpectedValuesForPolicy(p)¶

Returns all the expected values in the database which refer to a given policy itemID

Parameters:i (itemid) – the itemID of the policy
Returns:the expectedvalue
Return type:ReturncCode
a10.asvr.expectedvalues.getExpectedValuesFull()¶

Returns all the expected values in the database

Returns:list of expected values
Return type:list dict
a10.asvr.expectedvalues.updateExpectedValue(i)¶

Adds an expected value structure

Parameters:e (ExpectedValue) – the expected value as a dict. Must contain an itemid of the item to be updated.
Returns:returns Success and the generated itemid, or ADDITEMFAIL and a message
Return type:ReturnCode

a10.asvr.results module¶

a10.asvr.results.addResult(e)¶
a10.asvr.results.getLatestResults(e, n=10)¶

Returns the latest n results for an element sorted by the verifiedAt property of the results

Params str e:the element id
Params int n:the number of elements, defaults to 10
Returns:the set of results
Return type:list dict
a10.asvr.results.getLatestResultsForElementAndPolicy(e, p, n=10)¶

Returns the latest n results for an element sorted by the verifiedAt property of the results

Params str e:the element id
Params str p:the policy id
Params int n:the number of elements, defaults to 10
Returns:the set of results
Return type:list dict
